Subject: The Smithee Awards
Description: The Smith-ka-teers watch bad movies throughout the year and clip the best worst parts to show our audience. 19 'B Movie' categories (Stupidest Looking Monster? Oh yeah. Acting Appropriately Stupid? Got that too) and five clips per category, the audience decides which clip gets to take home the title of best of the worst. Come for some or come for all. It's free, fun and other F adjectives!  Speakers include:Jeanette Quirk, Matthew Quirk, Amy Conlon, Kevin Hogan

Subject: Beginning Your Home Music Studio
Description: Filker Tom Smith talks about how to start your own home music studio.  Speakers include:Tom Smith

Subject: , When being 'on' is part and parcel of what people expect
Description: A panel where Mark Oshiro (Mark Does Stuff) and Tanya DePass (I Need Diverse Games) speak about the performative aspects of their work, including the need to entertain while doing blind reads and reactions to media and for Tanya; while streaming on Twitch/YT Gaming.  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Mark Oshiro

Subject: B.O.F. Dro Who
Description: Join fans of Doctor Who for an open discussion about all things timey-whimey. Birds of a Feather events are unmoderated.  Speakers include:

Subject: B.O.F. Sherlock
Description: Join fans for an open discussion of the BBC powerhouse Sherlock. Birds of a Feather events are unmoderated.  Speakers include:

Subject: B.O.F. Star Wars
Description: Join fans for an open discussion about the franchise, Epidode 7, and the changes the Star Wars universe has seen over the years. Birds of a Feather events are unmoderated.  Speakers include:

Subject: BOF Media Creators
Description: Doesn't matter what you create. If you want to to talk about music, movies, comics, writing . . . this is the place to share ideas.  Birds of a Feather events are unmoderated.  Speakers include:

Subject: Diversity in Geek Media
Description: The push for more diversity has become a regular topic in the world of genre media and games, from calling out instances of white-washing and queer-baiting, to protesting the inevitable and often inexplicable deaths of queer characters and characters of color. It's an exhausting road, but is it actually leading to more diverse and inclusive media?  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Ann Lemay, Lingjia Tang, Mark Oshiro

Subject: Finding the Right Social Media
Description: Finding the right social media platform to build your business is tricky. Should you use Facebook, Youtube, Twitter, Instagram, the list goes on and on. This panel will explore what options that can work for you.  Speakers include:Kass Lawrence

Subject: Geek Girls Are Here to Stay
Description: Every few years it seems there's a rash of discussion, usually shocked, that women create and consume all the things long considered the domain of men: science, technology, science fiction, comics, games and more.  But women have always been there, from the earliest Worldcons to the Save Star Trek campaign, from fan ficton and fanvids, from Ada Lovelace to Shirley Ann Jackson, from Frankenstein to our awesome slate of Guests of Honor.  Will we be stuck having this conversation forever?  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Ann Lemay, Jen Talley, Lingjia Tang

Subject: Hamilton the Musical
Description: Discussion between fans of Hamilton the musical, those who've been to see it, those who want to see it, and those who just love the cast album.  Geek about history and sing along to some of the songs!  Speakers include:Jen Talley

Subject: Intro to Podcasting
Description: All the cool kids are doing it...and more importantly, even more of the not so cool kids are doing it - podcasting. So what do you need to know to get started? Go live or record and syndicate only? What kind of mics? What should you know before getting started? In your basement or a studio somewhere? Learn from local podcasters with lots of experience and known throughout the podcasting community.   Speakers include:Dave Phillips, Bob Waltenspiel, Nuri Gocay, Karen Hubbard, Shannon Marshall, Maggie Maiville, Jonathan Hickey, Scott Markwart

Subject: Intro to Video for Social Media
Description: Wanting to start a YouTube channel or adding video to your website/social pages?  This panel will provide tips and tricks to help creating videos for new or already established channels.  Speakers include:Scott (Toaden) Maiale, Christina Baade, Crazy Mark

Subject: Journalism Today
Description: Are Independent websites taking over media magazine audiences? Where should new journalists start and how is Traditional Journalism changing?  Join Junkhead Josh Jankiewicz (Hardcore Gaming 101) Ay-hole Andy (blahblahmusic .com) and veteran journalists Erica McClain and Dave Herndon as they share their experiences and tips about Journalism.  Speakers include:'Ay-hole' Andrew Zelasko, 'Junkhead' Joshua Jankiewicz, David Herndon, Erica McClain

Subject: Live Podcast: Getting Drunk with Shannon & Maggie
Description: Shannon and Maggie are BFFâ€™s and they (used to) drink, a lot. Join us for our 3rd time at Penguicon. Hilarity will ensue, we will drink, eat cheese, and discuss the latest events in life and entertainment. Audience members will be able to submit questions to be answered live during the session directly, during the recording, to Shannon and Maggie or via Twitter at @ShannonsParty and @BrainOfMaggie   Speakers include:Shannon Marshall, Maggie Maiville

Subject: Music Parody Performance: Derwood Bowen
Description: Derwood Bowen is a multi-genre comedy artist from the suburbs of Columbus, OH, and his live show comes with fun songs, lots of props, occasional attire changes, and audience involvement.  If you're in need of a good laugh, this is the place to go for it!  Speakers include:Derwood Bowen

Subject: ScreenWriting Tips
Description: Aching to write a script for that great movie idea that's been bouncing around in your head? Come get some tips and tricks for how to get started on writing a script.  Speakers include:James Fernandez, Mary Lynn Gibbs, Dave Kilgore

Subject: Social Media Entertainers Collide
Description: Entertainers from different aspects of social media (YouTube, Podcasting, Music, Public Television, and others) discuss aspects of working on-line and sharing their experiences.   Speakers include:Kass Lawrence, Crazy Mark, Dave Phillips, Bob Waltenspiel, Nuri Gocay, Karen Hubbard, Scott (Toaden) Maiale, BluRaven C. Houvener, Trooper Isomorph, Trooper Mindtrick

Subject: The Found Footage Short Film Format - 'Haunt Hunters'
Description: Screening of a series of locally-produced found footage short films called 'Haunt Hunters' that deal with an investigative team on the hunt for ghosts, zombies and the supernatural. A total of three films about 10 minutes each. Q and A with creators following screening.  Speakers include:Mike Madigan, Matthew Peach

Subject: The Pre-Production Process for Films - Where It All Comes Together:
Description: Learn more about the screenwriting process and getting your short or feature film ready for production, as well as the pre-production elements of casting, securing locations, choosing the right gear for your production, and getting your production team together.  Speakers include:Mike Madigan, Matthew Peach

Subject: The Return of Mary Sue
Description: The concept of the Mary Sue is back with the criticisms of Star Wars Episode VII's Rey as an unrealistic hero. How does this critique of female characters impact our perceptions of competent women?  Why do men get unrealistic idealized male characters as heroes as the norm in SFF media, but female characters with the same traits are ridiculed?   Speakers include:Ann Lemay, Ann Leckie, Merrie Haskell

Subject: Tips for Submitting to Film Festivals
Description: So your short or feature film is finally complete and ready to screen to audiences- now what? Learn the secrets of submitting correctly to film festivals, what film festivals look for in your film, and which film festivals to target/which ones to avoid depending on your project.  Speakers include:Mike Madigan, Matthew Peach

Subject: Video shorts
Description: Come watch some short films by local filmakers, on topics ranging from music videos and comedy to suspense drama and zombie sci-fi!  Dave Kilgore: Percipient (9:35); I got no Talent (2:30); When the Lord Comes to Drown Us All Again (2:35). Gabrielle Gamache-Nettles: Crosscurrent (7:22), Squisher's Atonement (14:00).  Scott (Toaden) Maiale: Win the Cure (3:00), Single White Vlogger (20:00).  Please note some of these contain adult language and situations.  Speakers include:Scott (Toaden) Maiale, Gabrielle Gamache-Nettles, Dave Kilgore

Subject: Wesley and the Crushers
Description: Wesley and the Crushers is a modern, one-of-a-kind musical exploration that is both 'geeky' and passionate -- passionate in their admiration and love for all things 'geeky' -- and completely geeked-out in their approach to their number-one passion, which is music.  Speakers include:
